page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY 2
page.content: The village of Teignwick became {Highweek}and remained a small viilage community until about 25 years ago when it was absorbed by the rapidly spreading Newton Abbot. The fields to the south west were sold as building land and the newest part of Newton, {Bradley Barton.}Newton Abbot itself is two medieval market villages,{Newton {Abbot and Newton Bushell.}The land mark that is Newton's symbol is{ {St.Leonard's Tower.}It was once a church but unfortunately in 1835 the nave was demolished to give traffic better access. In{1688}when King JamesII was forced to flee the country the new monarchs,{William and Mary} landed at Brixham and travelled to Newton, proclaiming their rule at the tower. The Tower remains, now part of a one-way system, complete with litter bins, plaque, and seat!
